title: Look inside Sheraton Boston’s whimsical new Goodnight Moon suite
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Sheraton Boston Hotel unveils a Goodnight Moon suite, available until Feb. 28, 2026, inspired by the classic children's book.
The suite includes thematic features like green walls, a red carpet, and a glowing LED fireplace, accommodating two adults and two children.
Guests receive amenities including milk and cookies, a plush bunny, and a $150 food and beverage credit at the hotel's dining venues.

title: 2 kilos of fentanyl recovered after investigation into Southwest Corridor drug activity, police say
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Boston police seized over 2 kilograms of fentanyl in Dorchester, Mattapan, and Roxbury after a lengthy investigation.
Five individuals were arrested, and officers seized ammunition, scales, drug packaging materials, and over $3,000.
Ricky Soto-Arias, 36, of Dorchester, was charged with Class A trafficking and unlawful possession of ammunition.

title: 2 MBTA operators sent to hospital after fallen wire causes fire near BC
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Two MBTA operators taken to hospital after smoke inhalation from fire caused by fallen wire near Boston College Yard.
110 feet of overhead wire fell on tracks, sparking flames; Boston Fire extinguished the fire by 5:26 p.m.
MBTA service between Boston College and Babcock Street resumed at 11:20 p.m. after repairs and mechanical issue resolution.

title: Abandoned manor overlooking the ocean gets new life in Nahant â€” thanks to Instagram
author: Regina Cole
bullets: Howe Mansion in Nahant, built in 1880, has been fully renovated and is listed for $5.5 million.
The Queen Anne style manor, which was once abandoned, now features modern amenities and restored historic elements.
Developer Ricky Beliveau was inspired to save the house after being tagged on Instagram by a follower.

title: Review & setlist: Natalie Merchant strips back the music in support of Beverly’s Grateful Friends
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: Natalie Merchant performed a stripped-down concert at The Cabot in Beverly on November 9, 2025.
The benefit concert supported Grateful Friends, a nonprofit aiding cancer patients with utility and grocery expenses.
Merchant's setlist included reimagined versions of "Carnival," "Wonder," and 10,000 Maniacs' "These Are Days."]}

title: ‘Confusing’: What readers think of hybrid traffic lights
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Hybrid traffic lights in Massachusetts are confusing to many drivers, with 59% of respondents unsure about their function.
A UMass Amherst study found 65% of drivers incorrectly proceed through flashing red lights, risking pedestrian safety.
Massachusetts currently has around 40 pedestrian hybrid beacons with plans for expansion, facing calls for better driver education.

title: 230 UMass Amherst students displaced after fire at off-campus apartment complex
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A fire at a construction site spread to an apartment complex, displacing 230 UMass Amherst students.
The fire led to explosions and a crane collapse; no reported injuries but some pets were lost.
The building was demolished for safety; UMass, Red Cross, and others are assisting displaced students.

title: Gabriela Coletta Zapata says she has secured Boston City Council presidency
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Gabriela Coletta Zapata has secured enough votes to become the next Boston City Council president, starting in January.
Coletta Zapata has been a councilor since 2022, representing East Boston, Charlestown, and the North End.
Her main focus as a councilor has been addressing high housing costs and engaging closely with her constituents.

title: Local obituary: Henry Oberlander, 29, standout wrestler at Xaverian Brothers and Bridgewater State
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Henry Oberlander, 29, of Norwood, MA, died in a car accident on November 5, 2025.
Oberlander was a standout wrestler at Xaverian Brothers High School and Bridgewater State University.
He worked as a laborer and was pursuing academic courses to join his father's engineering business.

title: Boston.com readers share how the reduction in flights has impacted their travels
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Logan Airport faced significant delays and cancellations due to FAA reductions caused by the government shutdown.
Over 2,700 U.S. flights were canceled on Sunday; Logan experienced 440 delays and 107 cancellations that day.
Nearly 200 Boston.com readers shared travel disruptions, with 45% affected by the reduced flight schedules.
